page.title: 09BENENDEN WEALD, FOREST FARM.
page.content: Forest Farm is almost in the centre of our block of grid squares and as the farmer and his wife and family have a long and close connection with our school we asked them if we could visit the farm and study it as part of this project. They took over the land when he was de-mobilised in 1946 and we particularly wanted to know about the changes, which are described on the following pages. The farm and their family have grown and the two sons with their wives and families play a full part in farm life. The farmer lives in a bungalow which although modern has the traditional open door welcome to everyone and is the focus of all their activities. This farm combines the characteristics of a modern business very successfully with the traditional family farming way of life.
